title: George Conway: Trump's Syria decision is a 'colossal geopolitical blunder of historic significance'
text:
CLOSE Turkish artillery was fired into northern Syria on Friday as Turkey continues its offensive against Kurdish fighters that it considers to be terrorists. Kurdish fighters were seen preparing for battle in Syria on Thursday. (Oct 11) AP, AP

WASHINGTON – George Conway, conservative lawyer and husband to White House counselor Kellyanne Conway, slammed President Donald Trump’s decision to pull U.S. troops out of northeastern Syria as making a "colossal geopolitical blunder of historic significance."

In a series of tweets sent Monday, Conway, who is a consistent critic of the President, said Trump has “failed miserably” and is “incompetent and ignorant.”

“No amount of your desperate, whiny, and pathetic tweeting can undo that simple fact,” he said, quoting one of Trump’s tweets that claims he defeated “100% of the ISIS Caliphate.”

Trump’s decision has cleared the way for Turkey to launch a military offensive in the region, as it views a Kurdish militia that dominates the U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Forces as a terrorist group.

.@realDonaldTrump: You’re incompetent and ignorant, and you’ve failed miserably, having made a colossal geopolitical blunder of historic significance. No amount of your desperate, whiny, and pathetic tweeting can undo that simple fact. https://t.co/QHnjldms62 — George Conway (@gtconway3d) October 14, 2019

Critics of the decision have come from both sides of the aisle, and they argue the action has betrayed a close U.S. allyship with the Kurds and risks creating a chaotic and dangerous situation where thousands of Islamic State group fighters languish in Kurdish-run detention centers.

More: Gordon Sondland, Syria talks, Columbus Day: 5 things you need to know Monday

Conway continued Monday to call out conservative lawmakers for not saying the President’s name as they critiqued the policy decision in their tweets, and the hashtag #SayHisName was trending.

“Bravo,” he told Rep. Adam Kinzinger who is an Air Force veteran, “Other Republicans should #SayHisName, just like this.”

Despite reports emerging that hundreds of ISIS supporters have escaped Kurdish-established detention camp, Ain Issa, after Turkish airstrikes hit the area and that the Kurds announcing a deal with Syria’s Russian backed government, Trump has defended the move.

Additionally, on Monday, Trump repeated a threat to impose sanctions on Turkey, tweeting out a lengthy statement that was short on specifics: “This Order will enable the United States to impose powerful additional sanctions on those who may be involved in serious human rights abuses, obstructing a ceasefire, preventing displaced persons from returning home, forcibly repatriating refugees, or threatening the peace, security, or stability in Syria.”

Statement from President Donald J. Trump Regarding Turkey’s Actions in Northeast Syria pic.twitter.com/ZCQC7nzmME — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 14, 2019

"Yes, Turkey should sanctioned," Conway blasted Monday, continuing that he believes that Trump "should be sanctioned too, for your idiocy, ignorance, ineptitude, impulsivitity, and your infidelity to our nation’s interests, in making the decision you were told would lead to the calamitous consequences we’ve now seen."

Contributing: David Jackson, John Fritze, and Courtney Subramanian
